Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WhosTheStew
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would go to Paris and stay at a Best Western hotel but this hotel offered me everything I wanted for my vacation.This was a mother and 17 year old daughter trip to Paris. Also, both of our first time to Paris. I don't think I could have picked a better location... the Latin Quarter. We took the RER B train from the airport to the Saint-Michel - Notre-Dame stop. It's about a 30 minute ride. This metro stop is directly in front of Notre Dame. Then we walked about 3 blocks to our hotel. Our room wasn't ready so we left our bags at the front desk (we keep travel locks on our luggage) & walked back to Notre Dame for about an hour then went back to the hotel to check in. If you've read all the other reviews then you know that the rooms are super tiny but they are very clean. We brought our own travel size shampoo & conditioner. There is a room safe that we kept our passports, money & Kindle Fire's in but I'm not sure if it's really big enough to hold a laptop computer. We walked almost everywhere except the Eiffel Tower & Arc de Triomphe. The metro station is a block away. I booked our room over the phone because I wanted to use my AAA discount which is 20% off the online rate. I paid $126.00 Euros a night for the 1 Double Bed, Classic Room. It's February & slow season. I booked my room about 3 weeks in advance. I watched the rates go up to almost $250.00 Euros the last week or so before my trip so I'm glad I booked early. This hotel only has 40 rooms so I think the cheaper, smaller rooms book fast. There is another Best Western hotel on this street BEST WESTERN La Tour Notre Dame but it's not 100% non smoking. A 100% non smoking hotel was a MUST for me. We had room 203 which was right by the elevator and I thought that was going to be a problem but we could barely hear it. Our windows opened to the small courtyard so we didn't hear any street noise. The hotel offered free wifi which was also a must for me. If two people want to use the free wifi then the front desk will print out two seperate passwords for you but you have to ask for them. The free wifi worked fine for the first 3 days but on day 4 it went out & we never got it back. The front desk let me use their computer to print out out boarding passes. The front desk computes are not on the same wifi as the guest free wifi. We ate the hotel breakfast twice which is really good. Breads, cheeses, meats, cold cereal boiled eggs, juices, jams, Nutella & champagne.I paid $14 Euros which is a little high but I paid for the convenience of not having to get out early and walk around looking for food in the cold weather. We enjoyed our nice breakfast & then headed out for the sights. The hotel staff are very nice & helpful and spoke English. We asked for directions & they always gave us good directions. If you want an affordable, clean, safe, free wifi, 100% non smoking hotel in a GREAT location then this is the right hotel for you. If you want all of this & want to smoke then stay at the BEST WESTERN La Tour Notre Dame down the street. I'm so glad I found this hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for the location - but only due to ongoing renovations.”
Reviews.Author: HeiliT
Reviews.Content: The room was standard and usually goes for 250 euro a night which in my opinion is over priced for the accommodations. We paid 170 euro a night since we booked early and I assume due to the renovations (which didn't really affect us). After seeing another room, I realized we were in an updated room but there were "essentials" missing as part of the room, like conditioner, body cream - only body soap/shampoo. The breakfast was also included in our package and was quite good (amazing croissants, cereals, fresh fruit, yogurt, eggs, cheeses, baguettes, etc). The staff were super friendly and accommodating to any request which contributed to a good stay. The acoustics are not brilliant - we could hear the people above us moving around. Great location - close to the métro and within walking distance to Notre Dame and lots of cafés and restaurants (non-tourist traps - outside the Latin Quarter central area). Overall, a great stay but only for the price we paid. Not sure it's worth 250 euros - there's a better Best Western on St Michel for the same price of 250 euros we stayed at last time in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ItchyFeetNomad
Reviews.Content: Agree with the comments preceded me, the location of the hotel means I can get to most sights easily by foot or by the metro. Also upgraded to a better & newly renovated room for an extra 20 euro per night, which made the stay even more enjoyable without burning a hole in my travel budget. Breakfast was a decent cold buffet. All the staff I met are polite & very helpful. I would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and efficient staff.”
Reviews.Author: ironmanOxon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in early February in cold weather. upgraded to a better room for an extra 20 euros a night and had a very pleasant renovated room , 202, overlooking the street to the rear. Everthing worked and soundproofing was fine , Coffee and tea facility in room and heating worked well. 5 minutes to Notre Dame and only 20 min on metro from Gare du Nord. Plenty of good bars and restaurants close by. Le Reminet in rue Grands Degres was excellent. Room was not large and a heavy curtain was in place of a door to the bathroom to save space however the separate lavatory was suitably equipped. Good location,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Paris. Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaButorina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just great place to stay in Paris. Location is Latin quarter the best area of Paris, rue Sommerard is a small quiet side street just in a few steps from Saint-Germain and Saint-Michel boulevards where you can find everything needed - restaurants, shops, farmacies, etc. There are a lot of high quality french cuisine restaurants (Zagat rated) located in a few steps around. All main attractions are just in minutes' walking distance - 5 min Notre-Dame, 5 min Pantheon, 20 min Louvre museum, 20 min Orsay museum, 20 min Pompidou center. The hotel is clean, they have non-smoking policy. Breakfast is a bit expensive (15 euro) but it worth: they have plenty choices of cheese, pastry, cornflakes, eggs, fresh squeezed juices, tea/coffee and yes they have champagne for breakfast. Rooms are not that big in size but as I stayed alone for me it was quite enough space in normal twin room with one bed. Btw when I made my booking I've written in the comments that I'd prefer to have room with shower cab and on the high floor if possible. When I arrived I found they've satisfied my request, they gave me 5th floor and room was with shower cab (room 505 btw it has little balcony with view to Notre-Dame's spire which is a nice option). Actually one of the main things of this hotel is great staff, I have to say thanks to all of them for their kind help which is important especially when you're first time in the city. All the guys are professional, polite and really helpfull giving suggestions/answers to all of the questions. They provided me help with different things such as finding right directions/transport, giving warm blanket while it was really cold outside and even solving problems with my mobile phone sim-card. Obviously this hotel is the best choice to stay in the city, I'll definitely choose it again for my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: Breuklyn-Boy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late October 2011. I had a little trouble finding it when we got off the Maubert Metro station. It is about 1.5 blocks away from the Metro walking away from the Seine (if that helps). Our front desk welcome was perfection. Quick & easy. I did have a little trouble signing on to the wireless internet but eventually figured it out. I really liked our room. Kind of small but a top floor with windows that opened out over Rue de Sommerard. We slept with the windows open. Breakfast was fine with a good selection of breads & cheeses. Tres bien!

Reviews.Title: “Small, convenient, personal service”
Reviews.Author: judgereferee
Reviews.Content: Small well appointed rooms (also a large family style room but you need to be on the short side to appreciate it), quiet, small elevator, two blocks from the Metro and bus service, a weekly market around the corner, many restaurants and shops nearby, near the museum de Cluny, but all I have said before can describe many places on the left bank. What separates this hotel from others is the personal service of the staff. The are warm and exceptionally helpful and excellent ambassadors for the Parisians. Have stayed here three times, most recently two years ago, and each time was equally wonderful than the last. They took special care to see that our needs were accommodated. I would stay there again, and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and very comfortable rooms; great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Charlie300
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights and had a very comfortable stay. The room and bathroom were terrific and we loved the breakfast room. Great location, it's very close to everything. This is a fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Well kept small hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: RonFMiller
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small comfortable hotel in a great location without a lot of services, this is a good place. It's basically a small lobby with small rooms, but the beds are new and comfortable and the rooms are very nicely decorated in a modern style. The breakfast room is very nice and the food provided there is excellent. The staff all speak English well and are helpful.

Reviews.Title: “"A Great weekend"”
Reviews.Author: richsuz
Reviews.Content: After a long search we found this little gem(Dec 2011). Firstly walking in to a very modern and clean reception we were met by very friendly and helpful staff who went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We then were shown an equally modern and clean room(Maybe a little small for a superior?) The hotel is in an ideal location,5 min walk from the Notra dame where there stops for all the city tour buses(recommended),also very handy for the Metro(2 min walk) giving access further a field.But you don't need to go far to have a great day,just wonder off the side streets of the Bd de Germain for great Cafes,food and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a little gem”
Reviews.Author: emj_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2011. A great little hotel. Small but clean, friendly staff and a great location. Within walking distance of Notre Dame and local RER stations. Also great for the open tour bus which picks you at Notre Dame. The rooms were quite small, but clean and tidy. There was free wifi in the hotel and free tea and coffee in the rooms. The breakfast was perfectly adequate with meats, cheeses, cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurt, bread etc etc. Would definately go back here, no doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ayres4
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel, nice location very near to metro station and many restaurants around. Staff helping in everything you need. Clean and clear room. I really recomended

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Pedro666
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the 2nd week of October for full week. The best reason to stay is the location. Close to Cluny/Sorbonne metro stop, which also handles the RER C (to Versailles) and RER B (to airports). This allowed me to save on the trip to/from airport and made it very easy to get around the city. The second best reason is it's located in a great quiet neighborhood. Didn't feel like a touristy location of the city, which is what I wanted in staying here. Lots of bistros, stores, sightseeing and only 5 minutes from Notre Dame. Cluny Museum and Pantheon only blocks away, and you can buy Museum Pass at the Cluny. Staff was very friendly and accomodating. Room (#307) was very small. Bathroom was nice and almost as big as the room. Wi-fi worked great. My only complaint was that the hotel was very noisy during the weekend. During the week was better. If you're a light sleeper like I am, bring the earplugs or sleeping pills for Friday, Saturday and Sunday. That's why I can't give it a 5 star rating. But I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Turah
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really close to the metro station, the staff at the reception is extremely nice and helpful. This was my first time at Quartier Latin and I loved this neighborhood. It's close to the Notre Dame cathedral, Pantheon, many restaurants, etc.The room was pretty nice too, very clean, nice bed, new tv, etc. (I have stayed at the superior room but i think the standard room must be nice too). The breakfast room is quite beautiful but i have to say I didn't like the food (ibis breakfast is like a hundred times better, can't even compare) and the breakfast staff were really moody too and it seemed like they just couldn't be bothered with anyone. I definitely recommend this hotel and will probably stay here again (despite the breakfast issue). They also have this shuttle service that takes you to the airport for about 18 euros per person, you just have to say the time of your flight and they tell you what time they will pick you up. Pretty good! Free wi-fi too!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully located, quiet retreat.”
Reviews.Author: wellididntknowthat
Reviews.Content: Booked a twin bedded room for a four night midweek stay. Hotel is boutique style, a stones throw from Blvd St Germaine and St Jaques. Rooms are small but extremely well furnished in a modern but warm style. Check in was quick and they allowed us to store bags until our room was ready, we arrived a couple of hours before official check in time. This allowed us to take a quick strolll around the area and grab a spot of lunch at a nearby bistro. Reception staff spoke English and were happy to help with restaurant bookings and recommendations. Breakfast was served in a basement room and the selection was par for the course for this class of hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Hermione_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for three nights at the end of October and absolutely loved this place. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It's only 5 mins walk to Notre dame and within walking distance to quite a lot of other attractions (Marais, Louvre, Saint Chapelle. etc.). I found the area very safe and lively, which was my top priority as I was travelling solo for the first time. There are plenty of options for food lovers too. At there are many small cafes and takeout places nearby which is great for budget travellers. The hotel staff are simply great and very helpful. The room and washroom are very clean and well kept, but small (which is I guess normal for most of the paris hotels). While staying there I didn't even take metro, instead took bus 63 to get to Eiffel tower (recommended by the hotel staff). Bus 69 and 87 are also easily accessible. According to Rick Stevens paris guide book these are the most scenic routes. The hotel is close to Notre-dame RER station which makes it easily accessible from Orly airport. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “City Break heaven”
Reviews.Author: Nordiefolk
Reviews.Content: This was my first ever trip to Paris and I loved every minute. The staff were very helpful and firendly. The room was small but perfectly formed and was in a great location. Love the 5eme arondissement - Latin quarter, very relaxed and within walking distance of Notre dam, the Louvre and the Musee Dorsay.

Reviews.Title: “loved the place!”
Reviews.Author: saritalah
Reviews.Content: great location - walking distance from notre dame cathedral and cafes! loved the decor - the cellar breakfast room, flowers in the tiny courtyard and window boxes, the colors in the room, even the design of the cups/plates!!! great breakfast - good variety of fruits, cheeses, breads and "home made" jams. very clean room, superior twin is a decent size. very helpful people at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: funseeker777
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. It is ideally located in the heart if Latin Quoter with easy access to many attractions and many highly rated restaurants within 5 minutes walking. The hotel staff went out of their way to help including early checkin at 9 am and fixing a problem with the safe in the middle of the time during our last night. Bridgette, the hotel manager, is simply outstanding! They also made many diner reservations for us. See my reviews for the restaurants we visited if interested. The room was a bit on a small side with full size bed, but not to bad, and they have more expensive rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to visit Paris”
Reviews.Author: fernap
Reviews.Content: I've spent in this little hotel a long weekend in springtime. It is perfectly located, next to RER station and walking distance to Notre Dame and Latin District. Rooms are a little small (as most in Paris) and a little noisy, but still not so bad for staying. Anyway rooms are clean. Breakfast could be better, considering that usually in France you are supposed to have the best croissant of the world! I would suggest to stay at Jardin de Cluny mostly for the perfect position and quite good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Value and Location Perfect”
Reviews.Author: little_sou
Reviews.Content: For a paris hotel this was quite nice. Rooms are not very big but thats Paris for you. Very clean and furnishing are modern. In a great location (the latin quarter)...just a hop skip and jump to many attractions like Notre Dame and St. Germaine area. there is a metro stop about a few blocks away which makes it easy to get around. A couple of days a week there is a market selling fruits,veggies,cheese and local art and jewellery near by. Really nice! They told us on check in that they may ask you for your key if you go out in the evening but we did not give it to them and had no problems. Would definately recommend and would go back. Make sure to purchase a Paris Visite Pass- (allows you entrance and bypass to some lines to major attractions...trust me its worth it).

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean and nice location”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie846
Reviews.Content: Overall, if you like to stay in the Latin Quarter, this is a good one. It's walking distance to Notre Dame on a quiet street. It was very clean. Some of the things I had a little issue with (but didn't say anything in order not to be the Ugly American) were: our toilet was in a separate little room on one side of the room, and the sink and the tub/shower was in a separate little room on the other side of the room (we did ok, though); the soap dispenser in the shower was hard to squeeze, and I couldn't do it at all;they didn't replace sink soap when I said the container was empty..nothing major, though..just bring your own soap and shampoo. The staff was very friendly, especially Andre, who even emailed me in the states and helped answer all of my questions ahead of time..he was great to work with. All in all I would stay here. It's a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to stay a bit longer”
Reviews.Author: jjmhen
Reviews.Content: We just walked in here, not booked in advanced and we got more then expected. A very nice room, a reasonable price especially for the location and nice service. The room are very clean and sweet and be prepared for a great minibar! We had a nice 2 days here and it made or stay in Paris even more pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “It was everything we expected...very good!”
Reviews.Author: Allan_Wong1
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days and 2 nights in Paris. The location of the hotel couldn't be better. Just 5 min walk to Notre Dame. A few minutes to Musee Cluny, the Sorbonne or Luxembourg Gardens. We were literally in the heart of the Latin Quarter which was lively. It was so hot during our stay but the hotel was an air conditioned oasis. The superior room was bigger than we expected but was barren without any pictures or wall hangings. The water closet needed some wallpaper or paint. Other than that it was absolutely fine. Andre and the rest of the front desk staff were so helpful...really tremendous. Breakfast was very good, ready made expresso and scrambled eggs. The buffet was fresh and well stocked. We had breakfast included in our room charge at 160 euros. Not a bad deal for sure. Would definitely stay there again but next time we'll stay in the Trocodero or Rue Cler. Not because we didn't like the hotel but why not experience different areas in such a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but adequate”
Reviews.Author: jmcgui11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights during a city break in Paris it is in a good location with Notre Dame Cathedral only ten minutes walk away and metro stations nearby. The rooms were quite compact but they were sufficient. We were on the top floor but luckily there was a lift so this was not a problem. The breakfast was nice and relaxed in a very unique setting. Option of a bucks fizz with breakfast was a nice touch as was the champagne in the room on arrival for our 'Romantic deal'. In contradiction to a previous reviewer we found the staff most welcoming and accomodating in providing us with any information required and for booking a shuttle bus to the airport in plently of time. I liked the fact that this hotel was an eco-friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great! Perfect! All +++++”
Reviews.Author: JensOlsson
Reviews.Content: Great Location! Very helpful and friendly staff! Clean and fresh hotel! Will return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel"”
Reviews.Author: sarandi2
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in a great location. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, from reception to housekeeping to breakfast servers. The front desk ladies' restaurant recommendations--all five of them--were perfect. The breakfast (included in the price) was generous. The rooms are a bit small by US standards but were perfectly adequate, clean and comfortable. This is "our" place in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and clean room but...”
Reviews.Author: nw05250
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and very close to shops and the metro with the restaurants of the Latin quarter not far away either. The room was very very small measuring just 9 feet by 7.5 feet with a double bed inside of that which given what they charge was a disappointment, The room was clean and so too the bathroom however there was a shower cubicle only (water pressure good) and no bath. We had a street facing room on the second floor (room 205) but it was quiet nonetheless with the double glazed windows doing their work. We didn't eat at the hotel nor use any of their amenities so can't comment there. One annoyance was being asked to return our credit card type key each time we departed the hotel. I can understand a big clunky brass type key, but a credit card type? I've stayed at hotels all over the world and it's the first time this has being asked of me. We were told it was to help monitor who was entering the hotel and to keep the ''undesirables'' out. We figured it was actually to ensure that people didn't overload the rooms with guests. We returned the key on our first outing, but that soon changed. When we returned late that night we asked for our key and without having to produce any ID or even give our name we were handed the key to our room. A very obvious and very serious breach of security meaning that anyone could've done the same and being given free access to a room.. On our next outing we simply held on to the key (after a brief argument with the desk clerk) and did so on further outings. Would I return? Probably not given how many hotels there are in Paris and thorough research would probably get us something better for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: warf
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here on a business trip in June. Close to Metro/RER and St Michel and Blvd St Germain, Luxoumbourg Gardens, etc.. Rooms small, but manageable. I had inside room. and noise was never a problem. Staff was friendly and rooms clean. Biggest problem for me was Internet access. It was constantly going down, and I would have to call the front desk and they would reboot the router, and in some cases it was unplugged! As I travel for business and work from the room at night, dependable internet access is mandatory. While I would stay here again for vacation, I'm not sure I would until they fix this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Andre - Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: Shimmystar
Reviews.Content: Superb location, especially for Le Rive Gauche. Many great restaurants nearby and the metro to the rest of the city. The room we stayed in was quite small but very comfortable and breakfast in the atmospheric cellar was a delight. What made our stay memorable was the friendliness of the staff. In particular Andre - did he ever go home?? The man is sunshine in a human form! You couln't leave his company withput a very broad grin on your face. This man is a treasure and should receive the Legion D'Honeur for services to tourism. We will most definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, worth the money”
Reviews.Author: TravelMamas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. The rooms are very very small, but are neat and tidy. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included with our reservation which was a nice touch although I do not think it would be worth the 15 euros per person had it not been included. The location is great as it is close to so many things without being on a loud street. There are no toiletries provided so donâ€™t forget soap, shampoo, etc. All in all worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly hotel close to everything you need in Paris”
Reviews.Author: balkanmomma
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights at this hotel during my first-ever trip to Paris. I chose this hotel based on previous reports on TripAdvisor. The staff was nice from the time I made my online reservation through their website (where I scored free breakfasts) until the time I checked out. The hotel is smoke-free and very clean. Here the breakdown on walking times to some of what you want to see in Paris: 20 minutes to the Louvre, 15 to Orsay, and 3 to Notre Dame. There are plenty of cute little places to eat in the immediate neighborhood. The closest one--and the one where the hotel will send you to buy your Carnet--is excellent. Many thanks to Andrea and Andre who were super helpful and nice when I checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable, with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: AlanSaffronWalden
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, in a quiet street near the Boulevard St Germain, ten minutes walk from Notre Dame. The room was comfortable and well appointed. The staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast, served in the vaulted basement room, at 15 Euros each, was reasonable value. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service and peaceful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexandre12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, 5 minutes walk to the ÃŽle de la CitÃ©, PanthÃ©on, Jardin du Luxembourg. Two blocks from the metro. There are markets near the hotel. The hotel is quiet and silent despite being very close to an area with nightclubs and restaurants. The staff are very friendly and always help when requested. The good breakfast is served in an interesting place. Good wireless internet access in room The room (superior room) was clean, well maintained, looked new, and it had everything you need as air conditioned, safe, mini bar, tea and coffee making facilities and hairdryer. The apartments are really very similar to the photos of the hotel's website. The rooms are not large. But large rooms in Paris are very expensive or are away from the center. If you speak Portuguese, search for Andrea at the reception. She speaks very good Portuguese.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: pauln65
Reviews.Content: We had such a happy time at this hotel. From the very start the staff were welcoming,friendly and helpful. The Superior room was large, airy, quiet and comfortable with a huge en - suite bathroom. The whole place was spotless and the location couldn't be bettered : five minutes walk to the Seine and Notre Dame, in the heart of the Latin Quarter. Breakfast was served by a lovely, friendly lady and was delicious. A final definite plus was the tea and coffee facility in the room. All in all we had a super stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone. P.Norman (London)

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely come back to stay”
Reviews.Author: Janner001
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in a perfect location - I would definitely stay here again. All the staff are incredibly helpful and friendly. Our room was quite small but not ridiculously so - it was large in comparison to those you have in New York hotels! The door between the bathroom and bedroom was quite transparent so you need to feel comfortable with your room mate! I don't know if the doors on all the bathrooms are like this to may be best to check when booking. Take a 10 minute walk to the Latin quarter when looking for a restaurant in the evening; the atmosphere is buzzing and the restaurants are far cheaper than those closer to the Notre Dame. We had a very good 3 course men in the price range of 15-22 euros...

Reviews.Title: “Delightful decadence -- champagne for breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: merab
Reviews.Content: We were late in booking, so had to pay for a superior room, but having seen some of the smaller rooms, we reckoned that it was worth the extra to wallow in luxury. That luxury included comfortable beds and a wholesome breakfast of quality food with -- unbelievably -- champagne on the menu! We found that most things we wanted to visit were within walking distance and would particularly recommend the Mediaeval Museum, only a matter of a few hundred yards away. There are plenty of exciting restaurants around, but for something entirely different, try one (or both) of the Tibetan restaurants on Rue de la Montagne Ste Genevieve, which have been going strong for at least a couple of decades. We were delighted with our visit and hope it will not be too long before we return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: fly_ebos
Reviews.Content: This has been my second time in this hotel and so far both experiences have been very good. The hotel is located in the vibrant Quartier Latin, plenty of good restaurants are within walking distance. The Notre Dame is only 5 minutes away and the Louvre about 20 minutes. Rooms are on the smallish side, but this is Paris. I've had a room with either a big shower or a small bath. The beds are great to sleep. One of the best features of this hotel is the breakfast. It is served 2 floors below groundlevel. Variety is nice, 4 sorts of cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurt, juices,....

Reviews.Title: “great hotel friendly stuff great location”
Reviews.Author: dudibar8
Reviews.Content: Just came back from paris after 4 nights in the hotel. The hotel has great location, 5 minutes from Notre Dum, in the center of the Latin quater. A lot of resturants bars and coffee places. We had a superior room. the room is small but very clean and new. Good breakfast including breads, eggs fresh juices, coffee etc. The stuff are all great, everything we asked we immediately got, they explaind us how to get around and were very friendly and always smiling.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service, thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: frostyboyuk
Reviews.Content: Jardin de Cluny is located in the 5er arrondissement, just south of the river & 5min walk from Notre Dame - fantastic location. MusÃ©e de Cluny aka MusÃ©e national du Moyen Ã‚ge, a medieval museum, is right around the corner. Jardin du Luxembourg is 10min walk south of the hotel. Metro station Maubert-MutualitÃ© is around the block - very convenient. Every member of staff we dealt with provided excellent service - friendly & polite - & they offered useful tips for getting around & info about local sights. They let us check in a few hours early & leave our luggage after check-out. Despite Best Western being a huge international chain we got great personal service from this small hotel. The room was compact but apparently this isn't unusual for Parisian hotels. It was very clean & well-kept. There's a electronic safe for your valuables & you have to give your room key to the reception staff each time you leave the hotel so security is a priority. My only complaint would be the popular modern hotel trend for the bathroom to be separated from the bedroom by a glass wall, with a gap in the door, so not much is left to the imagination when one of you needs to use the bathroom - it's best to leave the bathroom lights off to avoid embarrassment ;-) If you are a new couple seeking a romantic getaway in the city of love, you'll get to know each other intimately sooner than you thought! The walls are pretty thin so you do hear the other guests & staff in the corridors but this is true of all other modern hotels we've stayed in so wasn't too big a deal. There is free wifi - the staff will print you a login & password. Note however that you can only use this login on one device at time (eg netbook or smartphone but not both) The lift is very small - only enough room for two people + 1 suitcase - but again this seems to be the norm. Breakfast was â‚¬15 per person on top of the room rate but the quality is excellent - fresh organic fruits, breads, juices, pastries & cereals - the best hotel breakfast spread we've had. The breakfast area is in the cellar & is a very charming space (check the photo on the hotel website). The price is worth it considering how expensive it is to eat out in Paris, plus the fact that it's very difficult to find a cafe open early Sunday morning anyway. If you book your room through a third party vendor & use a cashback scheme you can make a big saving on the prices quoted on the hotel's website. We chose this hotel due to the good reviews on tripadvisor & overall we'd thoroughly endorse these & not hesitate in recommending Jardin de Cluny.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well-run hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: NNOP64
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after a lot of research to find a good spot for a wedding anniversary visit to Paris. Managed to get the Valentine's special that included breakfast and a bottle of champagne in the price - great value and a good bottle of champagne too! The hotel is clean, in a quiet location for the area and perfectly located for all the central sights. Breakfast in the exposed stone lower basement with wall tapestries was lovely. Every member of staff we met was extremely polite, helpful and eager to please. Staying at the hotel made a great weekend even more special and we would definitely stay there again if we get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “excellent small nice hotel in the heart of paris”
Reviews.Author: LondonGabriele
Reviews.Content: this small little hotel is placed perfectly for reaching notre dame, la sorbonne, and the shopping of blvd st. germain. i booked as part of a deal with the eurostar from london and got a great price. room was decent space, very clean, and they arranged a nice cot for our 2 years old daughter. breakfast was also very good and staff always friedly and helpful. really raccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Location was excellent”
Reviews.Author: JD3779
Reviews.Content: I liked how this hotel was located right next to a metro stop and within blocks of the Notre Dame. The staff was very nice, however, the room seemed small for the price that we paid in the winter. Despite this, I would stay here again simply because of where it's located because in reality, we were rarely in our room. The staff was also very very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Confortable enough”
Reviews.Author: RAFPERL
Reviews.Content: Very tight space. We where on the roof suite that is suposed to be the biggest. The toilett room is smaler than an airplane toilet. The bathromm is ample enough with a tub and a shower. If you are not going to spend more than 3 or 4 hour awake in the room it is ok. Clean, Free Internet and fast enough. Acceptable service in the front desk. Good breakfast (paid separately). Walking distance from main streets, restaurants, bus stations, metro and Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfortable and cosy room.”
Reviews.Author: Francesca35
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location within walking distance of many interesting sites, the river, shops and several metro stations - one a couple of minutes away. The (superior) room we booked was quiet and a relaxing place to be , the bed was very comfortable and the shower was excellent. There were tea and coffee making facilities - a bonus in Paris. The weather was very cold so it was lovely to return to the lovely warm room in the evening. We did not have the expensive breakfast but chose to go to the Starbucks nearby - or have tea and a croissant in the room (purchased at a local shop). Overall a good choice for Paris - good value for this location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at Excelent location!”
Reviews.Author: 984mirif
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay. The hotel is small and hard to find -at the first time, but very cosy, and the staff is very helpfull. We got a Superior Room on the 5th floor. The room was very nice (not too small at all) ,Bath & toilets were at seperate rooms(this prooved to be a great idea) clean and queit! The bed was a cormftable queen size bed. The "Cable TV" is a small Flat-screen with about 15 channels in Franch and several news channels like BBC\CNN. NO english -speaking channel! If you reserve the room via their site, you will get a free breakfast included (this was a nice surprise) for the entire stay! The location is GREAT!!!!!! Overall, this is a very nice hotel, that we recomment :) and most defenatlly will return there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrancesDecatur
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel. Very clean, modern, green. Room was not large, but few are in Paris. Bath was fine. Staff-all of them-very helpful and pleasant and knowledgeable. Did not have breakfast there - 14 euros - too expensive. Lots of places nearby. The location was perfect. We love staying in the Latin Quartier. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room, but Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chm1423
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, just a block or two from the Cluny Museum, one of my very favorite places in Paris. It was also quiet, which is important to us. Our room was very nice, but very tiny. It was attractively decorated and made efficient use of the space. The bathroom seemed to be brand new and was very nice. The staff were friendly and helpful. I really have no complaints about this hotel except the smallness of the room, which is typical of Paris. I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: No1Poppet
Reviews.Content: After much research I chose this hotel for our 5 night/6 day stay in August. Our standard room was on the 1st floor above reception, yet we didn't have any noise issues with reception or other rooms. The room was compact but with everything we needed for a base in Paris. It was extremely clean and the bed was very comfortable. The air conditioning worked very well and you can set/choose the temperature you like. If you don't like A/C the windows can be opened. We would have liked the shower to be more powerful but hot water was always available whatever time of day/night. The safe in the room could accommodate both mine and my partners laptop, and reception have passwords for the free wi-fi to be accessed. The wi-fi works throughout the hotel. A Kettle with tea and coffee are available upon request, and the mini bar was fully stocked. All the reception staff were very helpful and friendly. I liked that the hotel was smoke free, and that it was eco-friendly. The room key has to be in the slot to switch on the lights. There is a bar/lounge downstairs that was very comfortable to relax in and a breakfast room down from that. The hotel is located in the latin quarter on a quite road, very close to 1 metro station and within walking distance of 2 others. There's a variety of restaurants within all directions and it's close to many attractions. Looking forward to returning...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and friendly staff but very thin walls”
Reviews.Author: racerocks
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a comfortable haven as a base from which to explore Paris. It is within walking distance of the Louvre, Notre Dame, Les Jardins du Luxembourg and many shops and restaurants. Breakfast was included in our room price and was OK and an easy way to start the day. The staff were very helpful with any questions and the rooms were clean, nicely appointed and decently sized bathrooms. The only negative I would say was that we found the walls of the rooms to be very thin and we could hear everything, be it conversation at 2 in the morning or slighly more amorous activities- a little awkward when travelling with one's children! I'm sure this is a common problem but we have travelled quite a bit and not run into this to quite this extent before.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location, really friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: perce-neige
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 10 days while we visited Paris. The location is perfect, close to at least 2 subways stops, close to a small convenient grocery store et still very quiet at night. There is a/c in the room which was nice as there was a heat wave during our stay. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the hotel is clean. You should not expect big rooms like in the US as you are in the center of Paris but if you are spending your time in your room while you are in Paris, you should not have spent that much money to be there in the first place. I will highly recommend this hotel as it was affordable and nothing can beat the location, it is close to Notre-Dame, close to St-michel where you have tons of restaurants. You have internet access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Finally got a nice hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Goguca
Reviews.Content: I travel regularly for business to Paris from London and have struggled to find a nice modern-look hotel at an affordable price. After trying different ones around the areas of Trocadero and St Michel I finally found this Best Western. The rooms and bathrooms are modern, and they have a decent size for Paris terms. Lobby is nice, staff is very polite and helpful and includes free wi-fi. This hotel will suit business travellers as well as tourists. The location is just perfect, blocks away from some of the main ammenities of the city and from St Michel underground and RER station (here you can catch a train pretty much anywhere in the city, including Gare du Nord and Charles de Gaulle). I will definetely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: travelling-shoes10
Reviews.Content: I am a solo female traveller in my 20's. The location was close to a few metro stations as well as Notre Dame. I visited in the summer so it got dark quite late and felt safe wandering around the neighbourhood. There were lots of cafÃ©s, and specialty food stores to pick up snacks and meals. Room was a good size for one traveller and very clean with climate control. I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and met many different receptionists/concierges. ALL of them were very pleasant and extremely helpful with directions, suggestions for attractions, and booking tickets for shows, shuttles etc. They greated me warmly, helped with my bags and gave me a quick overview of the area and suggested somes things I could do on my first day to get acquainted with the surrounding sites. They also speak English as well as a few other languages (you can ask specifics if you book with them). I did find it a bit noisy outside the hotel but I found that most places are noisy anyways. People also tend to stay up quite late outside. My room was on the ground floor which was fine except I did not feel comfortable opening my windows because they open into the street. There are bars on them to prevent anyone from entering; however they could still reach in and take something nearby or see me sleeping which does not interest me. Breakfast is handy in the hotel, and the dining room is very nice...maybe worth it one day out of your stay, but there are much cheaper places in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The best little hotel in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: JosephineCapeCod
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 6 nights in 2009 and are going back this September 2010 for 4 nights. Best location (near Notre Dame Cathedral), Clean small room, very friendly and helpful staff, fluent in English. We tried to eat breakfast elsewhere, but decided that the hotel's breakfast wsas the best for the value. We will come back here over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: vapour84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in march 2010. We were warmly greeted by all of the staff at this hotel. Yes Parisians have a rep for rudeness but there was certainly none of this at this hotel. the staff have a thorough local knowledge and were more than happy to assist with travel and restaurant advice. Room was small but beautifully presented. A bit of dust in the nooks and cranies but otherwise clean and very tidy. We slept very well all nights, our room opened onto street levelo but we were not disturbed at all. Breakfast was lovely, the usual bread, cheese, ham, cereals, tea, coffee and juices. Very lovely waitresses brought tea and coffee and scrammbled egg to the table on request. Location was fantastic, 2 minute walk to Notre dame and the nearest tube stations. Overall, highly recommended! tip: We recommend the family owed chinese about 30 seconds down the road-very tastey!

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Houston76
Reviews.Content: Awesome little hotel for a weekend away, clean, neat, good value for money and superb location near to the market. great restaurants, metro. rooms small but quaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Superb Staff”
Reviews.Author: OldJoeClark
Reviews.Content: Good clean rooms. Very comfortable mattress. Excellent breakfast. Helpful and friendly staff. Great area of Paris with plenty of really good restaurants nearby. What more can I say. An historic stay

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel, great location, perfect service!”
Reviews.Author: kid1401
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Paris are tough to decide on. Rooms are always going to be small, service can be touch and go, and value for money is essential. The Jardin de CLuny hit top marks in all of the above. The staff are fluent in English (although I tried in French most days), The superior room is well worth the supplement, the king-size bed and flat screen tv is so welcoming after a long day. The decor is modern and sleek, The bathroom has a shower/bath. The tub is very deep. So inviting! The floor to ceiling windows leading out to the mini balcony are very cute. The street it looks out upon is quiet (parallel to busy St Germain Boulevard) and a baker, wine shop, newsagents and metro stop are about 20 metres away. A perfect location for any discerning traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Rosie_the_Riveter
Reviews.Content: We spent the final night of our honeymoon in this hotel en route home. The location is great but the room, while clean and well presented, was very small. The staff were friendly enough, but there were no little extras such as help with luggage etc., which you might expect given the price. We got a small room at the rear of the hotel despite having booked a long time in advance and checking in early. The hotel is basically fine, but very expensive for what you get, the price must be based largely on location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: BALDWIN2
Reviews.Content: We are yearly travellers to Paris in November. We found this hotel 10 years ago and stick with it, The staff is permanent professionakl and very helpful and kind. The location is just steps from Metro but in a very quiet street so that you are in and out of Paris. Breakfast is nice and generous and the stay is a delight as the staff keeps the hotel very clean . Certainly reommended.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique type hotel on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: Sarasotapat
Reviews.Content: The Le Jardin de Cluny is a boutique hotel in the Latin Quarter. Itâ€™s within walking distance to so many sites: the Seine, Notre Dame, the Louvre, Isle St. Louis, the St. Germain district and only a few blocks from the Metro. We enjoyed exploring the neighborhoods. The staff was bilingual and friendly. it is in a quiet neighborhood. There is an elevator (very small) and modern bathrooms w hair dryers. I would look forward to going back to this hotel. It was a relaxing and comfortable stay. Some rooms were small, but ours was a very nice size â€“ on the main floor off a small atrium area. We liked the contemporary decor and our king-sized bed. The breakfast room is below ground in what was probably a cellar or wine cellar. It is very quaint and interesting. We only ate breakfast the first morning. It was expensive and the usual Parisian fare â€“ mostly cold items. There were coffee shops and bakeries all around. There were many small relatively inexpensive restaurants nearby and bars that are open late. Tthe area is hopping but where the hotel is- is quiet. I found a lovely little boutique on St. Germain â€“ Save the Queen. It is owned by a young designer and there are shops in Paris, Rome and Florence. The clothing is very artsy/creative. Youngish â€“ but not too much. We recommend a restaurant near the Lâ€™Odeon â€“ Mediterranee. It is mostly seafood and very good. Moderately expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Location is super! Room was small but clean and quiet and staff was helpful.”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravelEurope
Reviews.Content: Very near metro and walking distance to Ile de le Cite, St Michel, Luxomberg Gardens, St Germain du Pres. Extremely reasonable price for Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great expirience”
Reviews.Author: dukered
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, perfect location, great service, good size room and bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ticketer
Reviews.Content: Great location in quiet street within walking distance of Notre Dame with many restaurants and bars close by. Rooms are average size for Paris but comfortable with modern decor. They were very clean. All the staff are friendly and approachable. Andre speaks perfect English but is happy to let you practise your French. Staff on reception are very helpful. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: susanjc
Reviews.Content: We stayed that Le Jardin de Cluny Aug 10-13th and had a wonderful stay. Our room, 402 was a superior twin in the back of the hotel. It was roomy (for a European rm) and had 2 french windows/doors and a nice view of a church and quiet street. The hotel staff were all very nice. In the breakfast room the lady who worked there made up a tray for me to take up to my my husband. We got the breakfast included rate of 10 euros extra, which for us was worth it. Many cafes charge 3-4 euros for a cappucino. As others have said the location is perfect, about 5-7 minutes from Notre Dame. Many of the boutiques and restaurants were closed for vacation . We ate our first dinner at the Village Ronsard which was ok, typical brassiere food. The 2nd night we walked behind the hotel, near the Pantheon is a great little street with lots of bars and restaurants, rue Moufettard. Beers in cafe and bars are expensive, about 7-10 euros and wine was around 4-6 a glass. But you can buy a bottle in the store for 1.50-6 euros. If we ever go back to Paris we would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible room”
Reviews.Author: takeomega3
Reviews.Content: First night they gave us a room in the back of the building accessed by a one person elevator. Room was smelly and the toilet wall was under constraction. The bathroom was old and looked dirty. This was our superior room. We asked another room and was offered a small double. We accepted because it was clean, secure and in the main building. The following day we asked the manager to give us a superior room and preferably the one they advertise in their website. He was very nice and we moved to a bigger, more comfy clean room. We often stay in Paris but never again in Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “An OK stay at best”
Reviews.Author: FastTrackDxB
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel for four nights late June. The best thing about this hotel is its location, AC, and friendliness of most of its staff. You're within a walking distance to just about everything. The metro stop is right around the corner, several bus lines, and there's a million dining and shopping options in the immediate vicinity. Housekeeping was not as impressive. Our room, though big by Europe standards, wasn't as clean as we'd expected. There was dust on the tables and lamps, old/spoilt coffee creamer (disgusting), small toilet room smelled bad, main bath wasn't better either as the bath didn't train well. We booked a 'superior room' but experienced nothing superior or just good for that matter. We paid over $260 a night for a stay that didn't include breakfast and wasn't quite satisfying. We liked the location and the courteous people who work there, but would come back only if there's no other option, or if the price is reduced significantly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KAM_Poole
Reviews.Content: Le Jardin de Cluny is just of the Rue de St Germain, a few minutes walk from the Pantheon, the Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter. On arrival, our room was ready (even though it was only 10.30am) and we welcomed to check in early. The lady on the desk was extremely helpful, giving really useful information if it was your first time in Paris. Our room, one of the standard rooms, was comfortable and cozy. There was a wardrobe and a free safety deposit box. The bathroom had a bath with overhead shower (my only real criticism was that the shower head could have been changed as was quite weak). Everything was clean. We overlooked a small courtyard. It was a quiet room but, I would think, even the rooms overlooking the road would have been quiet as the road itself was not busy. We didn't have breakfast included in our room rate and so ate for breakfast at a nearby cafe. I would book to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: goldie7111
Reviews.Content: Started my trip at another nearby hotel but was very dissatisfied. Luckily Le Jardin had rooms. Night and day experience. Yes, it was renovated and may not be a quirky little French hotel but to be honest, you can see enough of quirky, quaint life when you walk outside of you hotel door. My room was clean, modern and the staff was wonderful. I was there during a quiet week and paid about $140/night but if it were high season, I would pay up to $220/night. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, nice rooms, lovely people”
Reviews.Author: CaroVancouver
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on reviews on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. We had a Superior room with breakfast, the room is small like all rooms in Paris, but we had everything we needed and it was clean, which I'll take over size any day. The location of this hotel is GREAT! Close walking to the Cathedral Notre Dame, the Pantheon, the Latin Quarter, Luxembourg Gardens... As well, there is a market every Saturday, Tuesday and Thursday one street corner away which has excellent cheeses, local produce, etc. The Metro Cafe is an excellent choice for a local cafe near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little expensive...but the location and service are great!!”
Reviews.Author: vw260
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a great location. I will admit, though, that it is a little pricey (I paid on average 150 Euros a night). There are cheaper hotels out there that are given great reviews on this site, but this was a last minute trip and lots of the budget hotels were booked up already. If you have more time to research hotels and book well in advance, you probably will be able to find something cheaper. Nevertheless, if you arenâ€™t on a tight budget, I would definitely recommend this hotel. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. They were always willing to answer questions and give suggestions about sightseeing, restaurants, tours etc. They were a great resource. The hotel room was small to our standards in North America, but it was really comfortable. The bed was really comfy, and the room was extremely clean (something important to me). There is a fully stocked mini-bar, but the prices are a little expensive...you are better off going to one of the stores nearby and buying your own drinks and snacks. There is also a buffet breakfast each morning for 14 Euros per person, but I didn't really find it worth it. There isn't that much variety of food and it is much cheaper if you buy some fruit or even a crepe on the go. The location of the hotel is great. The metro is only a couple of blocks away and the hotel is within walking distance to Notre Dame (where you can also easily catch the bus tours). There are plenty of restaurants just minutes away, and most of them have affordable menus (many give you a three course meal for 10 to 15 Euros). Overall, I was very pleased with this hotelâ€¦I would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “You Wouldn't Know It's a Best Western Except for the Sign Out Front!”
Reviews.Author: rbsilver
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I visited Paris for 4 days this spring. This was my third trip to Paris and this hotel was perfect! It is in a great location. While the Left Bank isn't the most convenient via Metro, this hotel is a very short walk from two metro stops (St. Michele and Cluny) and a very easy walk to Notre Dame. The rooms are just right. Small (as to be expected) but modern, clean, and well appointed. The front desk staff was awesome. They all spoke English; however, they were very encouraging and helped me practice my very rusty French. They were patient and even had a great sense of humor. France is really changing! The first night of our stay they recommended a great restaurant nearby and then over the course of our stay confirmed reservations, helped with taxis and even kept my luggage after it was lost and brought to the hotel late in the evening. Apparently, a new trend in European hotels is "all in one" soap/shampoo with no individual containers so be sure to bring your own if this is important to you!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: Roy-Mac1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in February as a mini break. The hotel is ideally situated in the Latin Quarter. The train from CDG stops in St. Michel Metro which is a 5-10 walk to the hotel. The area itself is nice and quiet, rooms are very small but very clean and safe. Location couldn't be better as the hotel is less than a 10 minute walk to both the Panethon and Notre Dame. Loads of restuarants, bars in the area especially as you get closer to the Seine. Brasseire Balzar was excellent and is only a 3 min walk from the hotel on Rue des Ecoles. Bars on Rue de la huchette are lively especially at the weekends but avoid the restaurants, prices are good but the food is only average. I would recommend taking a small walk off the side streets for better options. There is a Metro line 2 min walk from the hotel which will bring you to the Effiel Tower and Bastille. The St. Michel metro can bring you everywhere else. Best to buy a one day pass. Check out montmarte areas loads of cool places and theres a good vibe up there. Also there is a nice french market by the Bastille on sunday mornings. Loads of foods, wine etc. Overall we loved Paris and this hotel is an ideal base for the first time traveller to explore the cities sights.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel for the money!”
Reviews.Author: JD_ES_03
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in March. The hotel was clean and rooms were modern. We had a superior room that had plenty of space. The queen bed is actually two singles pushed together so it is really a king. the breakfast was great and the staff accommodating. The location in the latin Quarter was close to the metro and Notre Dame. The area seemed to have a younger crowd. Overall we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: tommco
Reviews.Content: I didn't have high expectations, knowing that Paris hotels can be very small. Overall, our stay here was pleasant, but also pricey. Nothing exceptionally great about the hotel but nothing bad either. Good location though. It's hard for me to know how they compared to lesser-priced hotels in good locations in Paris, but still didn't seem like a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Student party spoiled the visit”
Reviews.Author: C_GLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: This hotel has nicely decorated rooms (we stayed in a superior queen deluxe room) which are spotlessly clean. Unfortunately they are a little on the small side. But we were expecting this. However, that's not the major problem. It's more about the neighbours. This is a predominantly student area of Paris (Latin Quarter) which is great for reasonably priced bistros and cafes but not so good if your neighbours decide to have an all night party in the building opposite the hotel. The party finished at 5.00am. We had little sleep at all, which was pretty annoying as the room wasn't exactly cheap. We've stayed in cheaper and better in London. Unfortunately the hotel were unable to find us an alternative room and seemed fairly disinterested in our complaint. They were unable (or unwilling) to compensate us, as we'd booked through a travel agent. So it's a decent hotel close to all of Paris' major attractions but be prepared to risk noise from your student neighbours.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel in expensive paris”
Reviews.Author: petdenrock
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel, unbeleivable location, so central to all main parts of paris but tucked away in quiet sidestreet, we had a front room with opening windows but no traffic noise . rooms as lot of posts on this site are very small,but exceptionally clean and functional, good bathroom amenities. the overall quality of hotel public rooms is impressive. hotel staff all speak english, very helpful and polite. so all good-BUT- beware paris prices !!. we expected prices of food , drink and coffee etc to be high, but wow- basically everytime you sit in a bar, cafe or resturant it will cost more than you think. we walked everywhere from the hotel, bit far to the eifel tower, but feasible, loved the latin quarter, loved everything else but still reeling from prices, maybe easier in summer where you can buy from bakers/supermarkets etc. and stay out. try the square near the hotel from couple cafes, couple of bakers and across towards notre dam a pub called the long-hop {?}.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel behind the Sorbonne”
Reviews.Author: ronnstra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Jardin de Cluny for 3 nights, and enjoyed it very much. The hotel is generally in good shape and spotlessly clean, and the rooms are very elegantly furnished (we had a deluxe room). The service was good and the reception staff friendly and helpful. Everything in the room and in the hotel (the parts of it that we saw) was well maintained and worked well. Except for the bathroom door in the room, that was made of transparent, white glass and touched the bathroom floor (when the light in the bathroom is on at night, the whole room is lit up). The hotel tries to keep a green profile by inviting the guests to sort their garbage, and some of the food served for breakfast was ecological. Wi-fi internet was included in our room rate, and worked fine. The room was very quiet, no noise from the street or from other rooms. However, sounds from outside the hotel room door was easily heard (and vice versa). Breakfast buffet was very good and served in an atmospheric cellar- like room in the basement. At 14 euros it was more or less worth the cost (in particular if you arrive late and make it a brunch). The hotel is conveniently located in a quiet street 5-10 min walking distance from Place St Michel. The neighbourhood in the other direction (around Maubert MutualitÃ© MÃ©tro) is quieter and far more local and Parisian, with several good food shops and eating places, and a small morning food market.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: iandel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a few disappointing hotels in Paris, so this place was a pleasant change. The room, though small, was modern and spotlessly clean. The bathroom and shower were excellent. The location is ideal - very close to Notre Dame - and you can get there direct from CDG airport by getting off the RER at St-Michel. The Metro at Cluny La Sorbonne links you to the rest of the city, although you are so central you can almost walk everywhere. There are plenty of restaurants/cafes in the vicinity - Brasserie Balzar on Rue des Ecoles is very good. The staff were friendly & at â‚¬125 per night (excluding breakfast) it was almost good value (for Paris at least). I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FiCairns
Reviews.Content: After reading alot of reviews over many days I chose the Le Jardin de Cluny and was extremely pleased. Our stay was for 3 nights from 23rd Nov 2008. We chose a deluxe/superior room . Checkin was smooth as I had booked and paid in full on the Best Western web site (best rate at the time) Andre was very friendly on the front desk and always offered a smile and friendly hello. The room (504) was on the 5th floor of 6, had french doors leading out to a small balcony and had views of the top of Notre Dame. The furnishings (incl carpet) were clean and fresh. The bed was very comfortable and was 2 singles together which made for a king size. The bathroom was relatively small but more than adequate with a shower over bath and wash basin. (The toilet was separate just near the entry door). Toiletries were at a minimum as the hotel is eco friendly and is trying to reduce wasteage etc...they are readily available on request. The room was of adequate size for 2 adults. The TV only had 2 english channels CNN & BBC but we hardly used it as we were out discovering the city. The only minor disturbance was hearing the shower from the floor above but nothing that would make your stay uncomfortable. The hotel also requests you hand your room key in when you leave for the day. A little strange but something you get used to. Tea & Coffee are not supplied in the room however when we asked at the front desk a tray was provided with all the necessities within 2 minutes. There is also a mini bar/fridge in the room. The room does not have airconditioning at this time of year which is understandable however with the room heaters on we found it a little stuffy but did not hesitate to sleep with the balcony door open to allow some fresh cool air. Breakfast was available for 14 euros however we chose to go to a cafe instead or eat on the run from a patisserie. There are plenty of restaurants, wine shops and corner shops for your meals and supplies within 5-10 minutes walk. Wifi internet was available for free, a code is required and available from reception. We arrived at Gare du Nord from London on the Eurostar and only had to take the RER line 2 stops to Saint Michel-Notre Dame station...1.60 euros each. The hotel was an easy 7-8min walk. The location in the area of the Latin Quarter was perfect, easy metro access, close to the river (hop on, hop off boat-Batobus)and the Pantheon. I highly recommend this hotel for its location, friendly staff and and would not hesitate to stay again. You should not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Why Stay Anywhere Else?”
Reviews.Author: kennyk1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in early October, 2008 for 5 nights. This was our first time visiting Paris and we chose this hotel because of good reviews in Trip Advisor. What a charming French Hotel! The standard room was small by U.S. standards but had everything one would want- the room was spotless, the bed was especially comfortable, the shower water was as hot as you want and the flat screen t.v. was a bonus. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, especially Andre and Morgan. Although our room faced the elementary school across the street, we heard no noise, and there was no car noise from the street. The location, around the corner from the Sorbonne, made for a great atmosphere when walking nearby-a mixture of students, French merchants, mothers with babies in strollers and older people, great for people watching. The Metro is 2 blocks away ,cafes , wine and cheese shops, and an open air market are at the end of the block. I have no idea why anyone would not want to stay at this hotel, unless large and opulent is what you want. But if you want to experience a perfect French hotel, this it!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish boutique hotel in the St. Michel area”
Reviews.Author: Jemimagold
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Best Western Le Jardin De Cluny in Paris from Oct. 9-13 for 4 nights. Our rate was 209 Euros per night for a superior double room which I booked via Best Westernâ€™s website. Here are the key aspects of my stay: 1. Room â€“ Our room for two people was small but very stylish as you can see from my photos. I liked the fact that it was nicely decorated in a contemporary, unfussy style. There was a nice flat screen TV, a fridge, a safe, a big bathtub and a separate toilet room which had a full length mirror on the door which was handy. 2. Breakfast- Breakfast was not included in the room rate but a breakfast buffet was available for 14 euros in the basement. I didnâ€™t go there as I think it is much more fun (and cheaper) to have breakfast in a cafÃ©. FYI- there is a cafÃ© just around the corner from the hotel in Blvd. St. Germain which has wonderful cafÃ© au lait and croissants. 3. Location- One of the great things about the hotel is its location which is in the St. Michel area (Latin Quarter) but is on a side street off Boulevard St. Germain. It was a simple 3 minute walk to the Cluny-Sorbonne Metro stop or an easy 7 minute walk to the St. Michel Metro/RER stop from which we could catch the RER train directly to the Charles de Gaulle Airport for 8 euros one-way Also, on the other side of Blvd. St. Germain were countless cafes, shops, bakeries, etcâ€¦ 4. Air Conditioning- The hotel turns off the A/C in the non-summer months so in order to have moving air while we slept, we had to sleep with the window open. Thankfully it was October and it was relatively cool at night. However, if you are a light sleeper, sleeping with open windows might bother you as there were cars and scooters driving by at all hours as well as an elementary school located directly across the street from the hotel with loud kids in the morning. However, I am a very sound sleeper and I slept through it all. My traveling companion was less happy about it and said she was awakened several nights during the night by shouting people and traffic. 5. Front Desk Staff- They were multi-lingual, patient and very professional. They got us taxis and were helpful with restaurant reservations. We also checked in and out in a matter of minutes. 6. Internet- There was a charge to use the internet (3 euros for 15 minutes) but I think this is very typical for Europe and so that really didnâ€™t bother me. However, be sure to ask for the front desk staff for the â€œAmerican Keyboardâ€� as the French one has keys in different places and can be frustrating to use (the â€œ@â€� sign is particularly hard to figure out on a French keyboard). 7. BW Points- Even though I booked my room via the BW website, it did not automatically put my BW Gold Crown number with my stay so make sure to take the number with you to give to the hotel staff or you will have to email them when you return home like I did. I was pleased with the Best Western Le Jardin De Cluny and would happily stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew G
Reviews.Content: Rooms a little small, but it's a European city centre. Staff friendly and helpful. Very clean rooms and public areas. Central for all Paris sights. Tried breakfast on one day only -- very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: suzeclarke
Reviews.Content: This hotel in a great location however the rooms are very small and get exceptionally hot. The reception staff were very good and spoke excellent english and were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service and location!”
Reviews.Author: RVJV113
Reviews.Content: A Paris resident recommended Best Western as having great hotels in Paris, and they were absolutely right. We loved everything about the Jardin de Cluny. The rooms were small (typical for Paris) but spotless. The location was perfect, we walked everywhere except for the Eiffel Tower. The street was quiet with lovely neighborhood restaurants nearby. We had 2 children with us (17&12) and felt perfectly welcome. And, the people at the front desk were as friendly and helpful as could be. All this, and the price was very reasonable for a 4 star Paris hotel. Our secret tips would be to skip the hotel breakfast for 15Euros and go around the corner for a fabulous crepe breakfast! Also, there is a small grocery store down the street where cases of water are a great deal (as opposed to paying 3Euros for a small bottle at the tourist locations).

Reviews.Title: “Great centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: ValC123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good value for the money. It is centrally located, within walking distance to most tourist destinations. The rooms, though small, are clean and tastefully decorated. The washroom was a decent size (we stayed in a double standard room). Reception was friendly and welcoming. Skip the overpriced breakfast (15 euro, although standard in hotels in France) and opt for coffee and croissants at a cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Lewis
Reviews.Content: After much searching online my mumand I booked a Eurostar package combining our return fare and night in a hotel. We wanted something very central so searched around the Notre Dame area. I read a few reviews before we went for this one and so glad we did. I think it may have been refurbished recently - our room was small but well furnished with very comfy (twin, as requested) beds, very clean bathroom and flat screen tv. The lovely surprise was a pretty balcony with a view over the paris skyline - we were on the 5th floor of 6. Some of the rooms seem to face on to the courtyard so I recommend trying to get one with a balcony if you can. The lady manager was absolutely charming and made it a great stay. My mum and I hardly ever go away and if we'd had a grotty hotel it really would have spoiled it so I feel very lucky to have found this one 5 mins walk from the Seine. Breakfast is 14 euros and worth it as it's down in a sweet little cellar with a good spread of breads, cheese, ham, eggs etc - set us up well for our day of sightseeing. Lastly, I recommend walking over to the Ile St Louis for dinner in the evening. It's a lovely stroll and there are some great small restaurants. Seemed perfectly safe walking back and there are several bars to call in for a night cap on the way home...

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: Cari_The_Dancer
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews we decided on this hotel. We are so glad we did. The hotel WAS 2mins from the metro station, the hotel WAS 5mins from Notre Damme, the hotel WAS welcoming and friendly, yes the room WAS small but immaculate, clean and lovely fluffy towels. Great area with so much to do and see....... On the main road there is a little coffee shop where you can get breakfast for 2 Euros 90 .....a bargain for paris. There is also a lovely little Greek deli (on the way to Notre Damme) that you can stock up on Mezze, over the road from the deli there is a supermarket where you can grab a bottle of wine, some plastic glasses and a bottle opener....then take yourself down to the Seine by pont neuf and join the other couples and families for a romantic night by the river....cheaper than eating out.....perfectly safe and all within ten mins of the hotel. I would recommend to take a picninc blanket with you for extra comfort. We did this for 3 out of the 5 nights we stayed. The Latin Quarter is lovely, go up to Mouffetard (I think that's how you spell it, about 10 mins walk from the hotel) for drinks and food and a nicer atmoshere than the fixed price menus of the tourist hell that is rue de la huchette, a street away from Notre Damme. The fixed rice menus seem chea but the quality is shocking and the crowds are awful, you'll know where you are when you see the smashed plates outside the French/Greek restaurants there. Although I would reccomend the Jazz Club on huchette, Le Caveau De La Huchette. Full of great characters and everyone was up dancing until the wee hours. It is housed in a medieval cellar and is worth the trip just to soak up the atmosphere and people watch, get there early to grab a seat as after 10pm it gets quite full..and hot!! If you can swing dance definately go. I have travelled around the world and stayed in some great and some slummy hotels this was definately one of the better ones.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: SashaTexas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrific! Quite clean, quite comfy, breakfast was delicious. Staff was great, Andrea has been mentioned in other reviews of this hotel and I have complimented her in a review to the Best Western chain. I have visited Paris many, many times and have never stayed in the same hotel twice. But from now on I will only stay here. Am going back in October and have already requested room rates from Andrea. This hotel exceeded expectations!

Reviews.Title: “romatic break 4 nights”
Reviews.Author: planmagsN_ireland
Reviews.Content: stayed in hotel 17th july 2008 great hotel staff so friendly and helpful rooms very clean also mini bar in room breakfast is buffet with lots of it also champane every morning so near all main sites 5mins walk from norto dame no need for metro walking distance to Jardin des plantes best square in paris great restarents and bars lovely place and open to late at night but not noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: TropicalTravellerUk
