Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, recently-renovated, with helpful staff and in a superb location â€“ we were delighted with this hotel. The little touches made it even better â€“ free newspapers in the lobby and free champagne on ice in the breakfast room. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well equipped”
Reviews.Author: poshtotty
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring the latin quarter and St Germain, but still an easy walk into the centre of Paris. We just used it as a crash pad, so were barely here. Excellent double glazing and a quiet side street location. Super clean and good facilities. Compact room, but what do you expect in a big city hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nix069
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of May for 3 days. The hotel staff were very warm and welcoming and everything was clean and tidy. Our only gripe was the room was absolutely tiny, it was beautifully decorated but the bed seemed smaller than a double and we could only get ready one at a time as there was no room to move! Towards the end of the stay I was feeling a bit claustrophobic. But a nice hotel and cheap for the centre of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: prestongirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in April 08 and it was excellent. We checked in and our stay started with friendly staff that couldn't do enough for you. Our bags were taken too our room, granted they wouldn't have it in the lift with us but it was a nice touch anyway. Our room was delightful and looked out over a quiet street, we never got woke up once by any noise what so ever. The breakfast room was in the cellar, always plenty of room and the staff tended to you straight away. You had plenty of choice for your breakfast and it set you up for the day. The location of this hotel couldn't have been better, we were minutes away from Notre Dame. You had a good choice of eating establishments close by to suit all price ranges. This was our first trip to Paris and while you may have to pay a little more for this hotel, I can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tom08London
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights - initially we had a double room and were disappointed with the queensize bed so we changed to the twin option which was equivalent to a kingsize bed (both beds adjacent to each other). The new room was freshly decorated, clean and most pleasant. Very friendly and approachable hotel staff who provided tea making facilities for our room when we asked. A nice touch was the freely available Guardian and Herald Tribune newspapers at reception. Wonderful location - close to sights, cheap but good restaurants and the underground - took only 5mins by train to gare du nord for the Eurostar!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Jardin De Cluny”
Reviews.Author: gosmart07
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Jardin De Cluny was the perfect launching place for our first trip to Paris. We relied heavily on reviews found on TripAdvisor and elsewhere in making our plans. We finally chose the Hotel based on relative convenience to the Metro, room size (two twin beds in a 15sq metre room), a more reasonable rate, and good comments about the staff. From the first e-mail, the staff was prompt and helpful. They provided directions from the airport and Metro; they agreed to a rate found elsewhere on the web including breakfast for two, and also provided a sounding board for Ballet tickets. (Thank you to Morgan, Medjid and Andrea!) We reconfirmed a week or two before arrival, and received a cheery reassurance and welcome. And, when we arrived, Andrea greeted us with early check-in to our room, and even helped to load us into the lift with our luggage. She also provided extensive information on transit and sights, between other front desk business. The information was very useful to us, given our â€œrookieâ€� status, and we changed our first day itinerary as a result. The chambermaids, breakfast staff and other staff were all extremely polite and helpful. As requested, we turned our key in when we left the Hotel, and each day when we returned the room was spotless. I would say that we were a pretty low-maintenance pair of guests. We have traveled to other countries, so our expectations were set accordingly. Having read that rooms are sometimes switched on guests at other Hotels, we were a bit nervous at arrival, however, our room was exactly what we anticipated from the description we had received. The Hotel is on a quiet residential side street, so other than some noise from the TV in the room above, typical for a small hotel such as this, we found the location very quiet. Our room looked out over both a street and the bathroom window opened to the courtyard. We were very comfortable, and had enough room to leave our two suitcases out in the room through out our stay. Our understanding is that the Hotel was fully booked during most of our stay, however, there was always a sense of quiet and peace at the Hotel. We saw a mix of business and pleasure travelers, most of shorter stays than ours, and very few younger children. We chose to eat on-site, thanks to a good inclusive rate, and really enjoyed simply rolling downstairs to the breakfast room in the cellar (shades of Orwell). The coffee was delicious and strong, and the other offerings were extensive enough to give us 7 days of varying choices: chopped fresh fruit, various breads and croissants, multiple flavors of yogurts, meats and cheeses, cereals, eggs, etc. While this is not the Ritz, it was wonderfully welcoming and comfortable. The Hotel is small, but well-kept, and the staff really made us feel at home. They assisted with locating a pharmacy when a cold took hold, and also helped locate an internet cafÃ© for us when the Hotel computerâ€™s hard drive fried and we needed to access e-mail. We never felt unsafe in the Hotel or the area, which is filled with students, business people, tourists and residents. (And their dogs - watch where you step in Paris!) There are 3 Metro stations in the area of the Hotel, The Cluny stop being the closest at only a couple of blocks away. We enjoyed the walk to the St. Michel station, where there were more options for various lines. While we bought the books of 10 tickets, we were on the cusp of wishing we had purchased the Carte Orange. We did buy the Museum Pass (6 day) which clearly saved time and money for us -- we covered a lot of territory and this put us right at the head of the line! We did not try taking the bus, although the Hotel recommended this highly. There is a small store selling staples, drinks, wine very close to the Hotel, and multiple bistros, brasseries, cafes and restaurants to choose from. We highly recommend this Hotel as excellent value, great staff, accessibility to transportation, and peace and quiet

Reviews.Title: “Not Much to Complain About the Jardin de Cluny!”
Reviews.Author: Ouiparis
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our whirlwind 4-night holiday in Paris. We found the Jardin de Cluny to be a very convenient base for our third time in Paris. It's right near the Latin Quarter and St. Germain areas. The Metro stop (Maubert-Mutalite on the #10) was a 2-3 minute walk from the hotel. There is a small "convenience" store right around the corner, where you can stock up on water and other snacks. We were given room 506, one of the deluxe rooms, which faced Rue de Sommerard. Others have commented on the lack of a bathtub, but 506 did indeed have a full-sized bathtub. The sink had ample space to rest your toiletries. The decor was to our liking; no chintz, but contemporary prints for the curtains. Also, the king-size bed was actually one whole mattress instead of the usual two mattresses combined. Le petit dejuener (breakfast) was nothing to write home about, but the coffee was good and strong. The spread also featured eggs for boiling, the usual array of croissants and other pastries, yogurt, and fruit. Espresso and scrambled eggs were available upon request.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, excellent hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: chinagirlAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice, goodsized room on the fourth floor, with streetview. The room was very stylish furnished, the bathroom with tube! looked brandnew and was very clean. I felt very at home. The neighbourhood is great and you can walk for hours through the small streets, the Iles....The people at the reception were very friendly as well. So I had a great stay in Paris, and in this hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good base and location”
Reviews.Author: Alex04
Reviews.Content: Good location close to Notre Dame, Louvre and Metro. Staff friendly and efficient. Had two standard rooms and one superior which were a reasonable size, clean and in good decorative order; we only slept in them. The lift was a bit small if you had a lot of baggage. Would recommend. Alex A wright

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: jarcar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location near the Louvre, Notre Dame and lots of nice bars and restaurants. We booked a standard room which was small (like most hotel rooms in Paris) and a bit dark as it was at the back of the hotel. However, the room was very clean and had a lovely bathroom. The staff were friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and definitely a must for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: AustralianinHolland
Reviews.Content: A friend from Australia booked this online. I was meeting them and I just went along and booked the same hotel (so I could stay at the same place.) I was pleasantly surprised. The staff spoke english very well, were very helpful and very pleasant. The location is very central to all the major sight seeing points and walking distance to many good cafes and restaurants. The internet rates were very reasonable and the little lounge downstairs was great if you wanted to have a drink after hours or just have a tea/coffee. Would definitely recommend this place for budget travellers. Just a note - the elevator to my room (on the 2nd floor) was ok, but friends of mine (on the 5th floor) had to take a tiny elevator that only fit 1 person and 1 suitcase. Rooms were also very small, but clean and updated...but if you are in Paris - how much are you going to be the room anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: DeMammy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for 3 nights. It is very modern, clean, and quiet. There is a metro station just around the corner. We never bothered with breakfast so I can't comment but there were many places nearby to pick up coffee and pastries. We found the staff to be very helpful. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel very friendly staff good location although room a littel small”
Reviews.Author: origamicrane
Reviews.Content: nice hotel just minutes walk from notre dame. staff excellent very friendly and helpful. no car park but there is a public car park within 5 miuntes walk which cost 24 euro a day. hotel room was small bath room was clean but the room itself looked a bit dark anf gloomy and gave the impression that it could have been cleaner. Very small 2 person lift so if you have alot of luggage on your travels you should bear this in mind. although there is a very nice restaurant just down the road le vire prevvre

Reviews.Title: “Some problems”
Reviews.Author: scousewitch
Reviews.Content: On the whole this is a good hotel with friendly staff but take care to be precise when booking a room. I had booked a superior double room with bath and shower, but was actually given a room without a bath which was extremely small (to the point of not being able to walk around the bed unless sideways!) and had very noisy air con unit (305). Also the bed was tiny, smaller than a double. When I asked for a different room I was told the hotel was full and would not be able to move to another until the following day. The room I was given the next day (504) was much, much better. Significantly larger with seperate toilet and bathroom (with shower and bath), and quiet and efficient air con unit. And the bed was huge too. When checking out I was charged the same price for the tiny room I occupied the first night and the larger room I had for the rest of my stay. When I queried this I was told both rooms were refurbished rooms classed as superior and so were the same price. Although the decor in both rooms was of a high standard in no way were they comparable in size/price. I heard the receptionist refer to the second room I was in as a "deluxe superior" so would suggest anyone considering staying at this hotel makes sure that is what they request.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: RH155
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel with incredibly helpful, friendly staff. Lovely rooms, great bathrooms, good breakfasts. Great location - walking distance to St Germain d'Prix, buses, Metro. Longer walk to Musee d'Orsay, Louvre and more. Exceptional staff.

Reviews.Title: “good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: momtoemma
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old daughter and I stayed here for 5 days in August. We had a deluxe twin room on the top floor (502). Good size room for Paris. Our toilet was in a separate little room (like a very small closet) and therest of the washroom was across the room. Odd and a little inconvenient (ie hand washing) but no problem. No shower curtain and water pressure was very poor in shower. Good points: location- was great, very close to RER B if coming in from Gare du Nord (Eurostar) or CDG- very easy even with luggage- no more than 5 mins easy walk with luggage. Also metro line 4 and line 10 very near and some main bus routes -lots of restaurants and cafes -Starbucks and Haagan Das ice cream cafe -staff was friendly and helpful except they failed to pass along a phone message to me (no voice mail) -internet available in basement lounge area for I think 8 euros per hour (we used it for about 15 mins but they said no charge!) rooms clean, smallish flat screen tv with BBC and CNN Room was probably about 12 feet by 15 feet, (not counting bathroom area), and we were told we had one of the largest rooms. We saw a couple of other rooms and they looked very very small. This room defeintely had enough room to have 2 twin beds, table, and floor area for luggage, and you could still walk by. air conditioning worked well, and the large windows opened to a very quiet back street. No real negatives but I would note the following: 1. breakfast is 14 euros/person- very expensive 2. in our room when it rained (as it did 3 days of our trip), there was a very very annoying dripping sound onto the roof above our room- so loud it would wake you in the middle of the night, as it did both my daughter and i. 3. shower was poor water pressure, and no shower door Overall I would likely stay again but get a deluxe room if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and unbeatable price for Paris Weekend”
Reviews.Author: valleygirlCardiff
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful weekend in Paris. The hotel cannot be beaten for location and price. We booked through the Best Western web site at a charge of 109 euros per night, admittedly it was booked a few months ago and we got their Best Rate. The staff spoke excellent English and were very polite and helpful. Like most large city hotels, the rooms are quite small but you spend such little time in them anyway. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as there were so many great little cafes just around the corner. Splashed out on our last evening and went to a beautiful restaurant just up the hill from the hotel. Think it was called Le Coupe de Chou, not sure of the spelling, perfect evening. Would certainly stay at this hotel on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in the centre of paris,excellent location”
Reviews.Author: europeangirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in this wonderful gem in the centre of paris. The room was spacious,spotlessly clean with lovely friendly people on the desk. few mins walk to notre dame and all the bars and restaurants. Bagged an excellent rate of 109 a night on the bestwestern.com website (hotels own). I would recommend this hotel to anyone,I couldnt fault it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: SAC181
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel due to some of the good reviews on Trip advisor. Stayed in room 301, superior double room and we were very pleased with the standard. Very clean and modern and quiet. Air con worked well. Hotel staff very helpful and polite and spoke very good English. Easy to get to via metro and RER. Would definetley return. Would recommend trying the bistro Maree Vert located close by as recommended by the hotel receptionist. Great three course meal for 34euros a head, great service and ambience. All in all very pleased, had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Peter123Needham
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the location, a short walk from Notre Dame and all the activity of the Latin Quarter. It is also convenient to several metro stations. Our room was very comfortable for my wife and me, plus our 12 year old son on a rollaway. It's what I would have expected from a small European hotel - not spacious, but adequate and clean. I'd read others' complaints about noise, but our room, #02 on the ground floor, was quiet, even though the windows overlooked a side street. The front desk service was friendly and helpful. Their English was much better than my French. We didn't try the breakfast in the hotel, preferring to enjoy one of the neighborhood cafes, A few other tips: Despite what looked like a long line on our 11 AM arrival the Musee D'Orsay, it moved very quickly and we got in within 30 minutes. The Museum Pass allows people to by-pass the line entirely, but may not be worth it unless you plan to visit multiple museums. Finding our way from CDG to the station at St. Michel - Notre Dame via the in-bound RER train was easy enough. The outbound to Orly was a bit more challenging, involving a a couple of switches. Note that some of the stations don't have elevators or escalators, so heavy luggage can be a problem. The restaurant that the people at the hotel recommend, the Brasserie Balzar, is OK, though not great, and a five minute walk from the hotel. Adam Gopnick wrote about it in the New Yorker a few years back, but ownership has changed and it may be coasting a bit on its reputation. Or maybe we just had a cranky waiter.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: akolt
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at the last moment through WorldRes. Excellent location in the Latin Quarter. Room ( I was upgraded to Superior without my knowledge and was charged additional 25Euros per night when I left) was very small but suffcient for 2 night stay and for the price. Room was clean + very quite which was very important for me. Overall OK. Did not take the breakfast so do not know the quality. I prefered to have a cup of coffee at one of many coffee shops on blvd St. Michel for a fraction of a price.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: travelzilla
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a convenient location where you can visit Notre Dame, Patheon, Jardin Luxemberg easily. It's in the heart of Latin Quarter with lots of cafes and restaurants. It's also close to both the RER and Metro stations. The rooms are clean and size is good. Staff are very friendly. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: essiedot
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Jardin de Cluny in the "family room" on the top floor. I would highly recommend this room in particular if you have a group of three or four (or even five if one doesn't mind sleeping on a cot). The room itself was spacious, as was the newly renovated bathroom. I took a peek inside other rooms in the hotel and they were minuscule by comparison. Service was friendly and efficient. The only problem was a delay of about two hours before check-in- which seemed much longer because of our jetlag. The location is wonderful. You are just steps away from Place Maubert, which has several cafes and bakeries. There is also a Metro stop right at the corner. My favorite Paris museum, the Cluny Museum, is only a block away. Several days there was a great street market in the square with an interesting mix of food vendors and artisans. We never had breakfast in the hotel. I did take a look at the breakfast room, which is quite nice in spite of the fact that it is in the sub-basement. I still cannot imagine why anyone would choose the expensive hotel basement breakfast over one of the cafes in the neighborhood. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. It was a good value, well situated, and had friendly staff. If you are looking for a clean, comfortable, pleasant base from which to explore Paris the Jardin de Cluny is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Sarahkat83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Jardin de Cluny for 3 nights in late May. I chose this hotel after reading the reviews on tripadvisor and got a good rate on the hotel's website. We had a double room at the front of the hotel which, although small, was charming and equipped with plenty of creature comforts - comfy bed, flat screen TV, nice modern decor, mini bar (not overly expensive), powerful hot shower (no bath) and nice toiletries. In addition to the nice rooms, lovely atmosphere, decent value for money and helpful staff, another good thing about the hotel (as mentioned in previous reviews) is its location. It is situated on a quiet street just off the Blvd St Michel and is close to good cafes, restaurants, shops and sights. It is also just 5 mins from the metro, 10 mins from Notre Dame etc and you can walk to other central locations, including the Louvre and the d'Orsay within half an hour. It is also easily accessible from CDG airport on the RER. The only negative points would be that our large window wouldn't quite shut properly which meant we could hear some street noise at night. Additionally, we didn't have breakfast at the hotel, instead choosing local cafes, however we found that the choice tended to be limited and expensive compared to other meals. We would recommend Brasserie Balzar just round the corner on Rue des Ecoles for its food and wine, atmopshere and charismatic staff. Overall a great hotel for a short break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Watchung2
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel with a wonderful location, quiet street, convenient to laundermat, excellent restaurants, metro close by, and we upgraded to a superior room that was beautiful - The Rose Room. The staff couldn't be more helpful. They gave us great directions and recommended a wonderful cafe around the corner. We walked for hours around the area and would stay at this hotel on our return trip next year.

Reviews.Title: “Small, smelly room, with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: OxfordJack
Reviews.Content: I booked a room directly with the manager over the phone, for my wife, me and our young son. The warning signs should have been (1) the manager was delighted that we were staying for 8 days, and (2) the significant reduction from the rack rate that I achieved without any haggling. I was told that the room was large. On arrival the woman at reception was rude and unhelpful, and the room was in fact minute and smelt. The receptionist happily showed us into other guests' rooms, rather surprisingly, and these were little better. The lift and communal areas were claustrophobic. We checked straight out, and spent the rest of our first day in Paris walking the streets with a three year old and our luggage, looking for another hotel. This was preferable to staying.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Vivngeoff
Reviews.Content: Had a great 4 night stay in this hotel. Good choice at breakfast and plenty of it. Our room was small but had everything we needed. Bathroom was a bit odd as the loo was raised up (see photo) but we soon got used to perching on it! The hotel was kept spotless and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. Excellent position in Paris - a few minutes walk to Notre Dame and an easy 15 minute stroll to the Louvre. Lots of cafes nearby although we were a bit disappointed with the lack of menu choice in most of them. A very rude waiter at the Twickenham Cafe on the Rue St Germain, refused our request for a well-done steak so we left immediately, but apart from that one incident, we had excellent friendly service everywhere else! Visited Versailes via the RER and had to queue twice, first for the tickets then for admission. Apparently we could have bought the tickets in advance, which would have saved about 40minutes if we'd known, so if you're planning a visit, it would be worth finding out about that. Would thoroughly recommend the 'Jardin de Cluny' to everyone

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 30SOMETHINGSLASGOW
Reviews.Content: hotel staff very friendy and helpful nothing was too much trouble fantastic location 5 minutes walk to the notre dame where you can get the open air bus lines which take you round all the major attractions ideal if its your first time in paris as you can hop on hop off. lots of fab shops not all with designer price tags fantastic choice of one off boutiques offering great shoes and bags for the ladies and if you like the atmosphere of local markets then on a saturday morning just at the end of the street to the their is a local market offering fresh produce leather goods and ceramics all at bargin prices. within walking distance of the hotel you ve also got a great choice of cafes bars & resturants (italian chinese thai greek mexican indian and of course french) just dont order house wine by the glass as it is very hard to taste the diffrence between it and the vinegar pay the extra and choose a nice bottle (its not too expensive)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for shops, drinking, siteseeing etc”
Reviews.Author: ShazyLondon
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Paris and I was treating my Girlfriend as well so I wanted it to be right. When I was choosing the Hotel to stay in and I consulted tripadvisor, this hotel came up with great reviews so I went for it. To cut a long story short we were both extremely happy with Hotel and everything that came with it. Very helpful and friendly staff, clean and modern bedrooms, dining room, reception etc. Perfectly adequate breakfast, your usual contintental -crossiants, yoghurt, cereals, Bread and jams, Eggs etc. The hotels situation was great, just of Boulevard St Germain and about a 3 min walk to the nearest Metro, lots of nice resturants and bars very close by, so perfect for the evenings. A huge comfy double bed made for great sleeping and it was nice and quiet with the windows open. I definatley reccomend this hotel to anyone looking for a short break or longer. One tip however - if they try and palm you off with a small room at the back of the hotel which hasnt been redecorated (room 307) go straight back to reception and ask to change and they will. I read that this had happend to someone else and it happened to us, but wasnt a problem at all and they happily changed it.!! Have a great time!!!

HotelInfo.Address: 9 rue du Sommerard | 5th Arr., 75005 Paris, France
